so triggering it once would make it emit redstone indefinitely till it gets triggered again, sort of like lever but by stepping on it, not by clicking, it would work differently for different purposes than existing pressure plates, besides looks

I can suggest that axes will break shiled if you attack the player who has shield 2 times

Well, is implicit said that disabling time would increase with the enchantment level, and I like the idea to make tools and weapons more "clean" of special features, this allow for better control of results and diversity of tactics.

Chiseled Bookshelves:

  • Affects the enchantments that the table has access to based on the books inside the bookshelves.
  • Books in chiseled bookshelves are not used up once acquired on an item, but it is a random chance to receive the enchantment you desire. The chance being dependent on the rarity of the enchantment in the shelf and the tier of your Magician skill.

Enchantments reworked:

  • No longer have enchantment levels
  • Provide a static bonus depending on the enchantment applied.
  • Skills should replace anything that needs to be increased in increments.
  • For example, Sharpness would be associated with the Brawler skill, providing an incremental increase to melee weapon damage based on how many hostile mobs you defeat with melee weapons.
  • With Sharpness being incorporated into a skill, you would now be able to stack Smite on top of it, giving you extra damage against undead mobs.

Acquiring Books:

  • Librarian villagers are able to sell all enchantments, with the rarity being tied to their rank. Very rare chance to get treasure enchantments at the max rank.
  • Rare enchantments have a decent chance be found in any structure.
  • Treasure enchantments should be difficult (but not impossible) to find, and each one should have a unique place to find them, encouraging players to explore.
  • Fishing can still be a method of acquiring enchanted items, but the rarity of the enchantments should be affected by the luck of the sea enchantment instead of being random. Rare enchantments should have a very rare chance to be acquired by default. Treasure enchantments should not be able to be acquired by default. Rare chance to acquire rare enchantments and extremely rare chance to acquire treasure enchantments with Luck of the Sea.

Grindstone:

  • Repair and disenchant items like normal.
  • Rare chance that one of the enchantments comes off as a book.

Anvil:

  • Can be used to combine enchantments onto one book to add to the chiseled bookshelves.
  • No increasing penalty cost for repairs or combining books/items.
  • Static XP costs depending on the amount of repair needed, rarity of enchantments and amount of enchantments being combined.
  • No more "Too expensive" please!

Closing Statement:

I honestly think that certain enchantments were needed in the past, but are now simply cluttering our enchantment slots, simply because we have to have them (e.g. Sharpness and Efficiency). Ideally, I'd like to have skills to replace the crutch enchantments so that we can make room for enchantments like Smite and Bane of Arthropods, and add new ones like the ones in Minecraft Dungeons.

All in all, I think these changes will still keep the novelty of the slot machine pull, but make it so players have a bit more control over what they can get and also encourage them to use different enchantments, especially as they progress their skill levels.

If you like these changes or have any feedback on how this can be improved, please let me know! I'll be cooking up some new enchantments that I think should be added to the game as well, because I feel like all items deserve to have their own exclusive enchantments.
And then what will the experience system be needed for?

Great idea! Adding archery huts with targets and a special spot in churches to summon Allays would really bring more life and immersion to the villages. It would enrich the gameplay while staying true to the spirit of Minecraft. I hope Mojang takes it into account!

Both the old and the new systems should be combined. There should be 4 game drops and 1 major update a year.
Possibly each year could have a set 'theme'. So for example, 2026 could be Caves, and each update could expand upon caves. Or 2027 could be 'The End' which gives us more things for the End.
i do agree, i hate phantoms you win my vote

Hardcore players have to play on all the highest settings, though. A sudden difficulty spike might cause people to lose their worlds or just not update. I think this might be better addressed through a resource pack, add-on, or mod, whichever is most technically feasible.

(Continued from post) Once his health runs out, he doesn't die. Instead he just says, "Fine, you win! I'll be back!!!" in the chat. Then he turns into a witch, vindicator, or evoker and disappears. You'll never see him again after that. That is, unless, you decide to visit a woodland mansion afterwards. There's a 1 in 10 chance an illager that's the type the evil villager turned into will not attack when he sees you. Instead he'll say, "Wait, is that you, [player name here]?" Then he says, "IT'S PAYBACK TIME!!!!!!!!!!!" Then he starts attacking with attacks that deal more damage than usual. He also has a health bar. Once you defeat him, he explodes. He drops whatever what his illager type would normally drop. Then, the next time you enter the very same village you met him in, you get the "Hero of the Village" status effect for one in-game week(seven days).

Thanks for reading!!!

This is a great idea. Right now you have to destroy the entire outpost before the pillagers stop spawning, which is very annoying. This way you could make a pillager mob crusher, which would be cool.

Outposts should also have something on the lower floors. Currently there is one chest on the top floor, while the rest are empty. There doesn't even have to be anything good, just something.

BIG plus ones to this. I literally have to take days off of playing minecraft in between play sessions because my middle finger becomes swollen from continuously pressing W.

In WoW I have a mouse button bound and it makes playing games much less painful.

+1 for auto-run in general, but I would also love for this to work while boating again too!

We used to be able to "auto-run" while boating and it was glorious, but then it was stomped out like a bug and not appreciated for the beautiful feature it was. :(
One of my favorite activities is exploring oceans. Auto run would make this so much easier.

As an explorer type player, I deeply long for auto-run. There used to be a "bug" where you could kind of auto-run if you opened your inventory while moving forward in a boat and that was gd glorious. I did most of my exploring by boat during that time because it was so much more pleasant. Please give us auto-run!

No joke... my doctor says that I'm developing arthritis in my middle finger and the only thing I can think of that would cause it is pressing and holding on W in Minecraft... It's the only game I've played for years.

You can also set up macro's to auto walk. It will be exactly the same as holding down the W key on a keyboard. For logitech software you can select macro->toggle->record keystroke-press w-stop recording keystrokes->press the 2nd recorded input which is the release of the w key->press delete->save.
We need it sooo much man
I want to go back to my favorite version of the game.
Absolutely!
I do agree with this system! Mojang please recognize this and use it!

I think it would be useful if curses could be placed onto players without having to get a hold of their items first. For example, someone could curse someone to have some of their items vanish when they die
I think Bad Omen is a good example of something that is like a potion and a curse. Perhaps more things like that which can be placed on other players

Players could have the same animations as the Evoker when they do spells. If spell/enchantment books are used, they could open up in front of the player like enchantment tables or do a little flying animation similar to the Totem of Undying

I think it would be more interesting if the player couldn't use magic themselves, but could create a golem or device that casts spells or curses. That would remain consistent with the existence of the enchanting table and brewing stand, as you don't create the enchantments, just use them. Either that, or it should work like Minecraft Dungeons magic, because Minecraft Dungeons was declared cannon to the Minecraft lore.
